meanings.sent1: The predigested food was easier for the baby to eat.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended predigested meals for the patient with a sensitive stomach.
meanings.sent3: The predigested snacks made the picnic a breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her predigested knowledge of the subject helped her ace the test.
meanings.sent5: The predigested information in the book was perfect for beginners.

meanings.definition: To have undergone partial digestion before consumption.
meanings.sent1: The baby bird predigested the worm before swallowing it.
meanings.sent2: It is believed that cows predigest their food by chewing cud.
meanings.sent3: The chef predigested the meat to make it more tender.
meanings.sent4: The enzyme in saliva helps to predigest food in the mouth.
meanings.sent5: The stomach acids further predigest the food for absorption.
